result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Richard Monthey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to submit DNA Sample and Surcharge
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety, 6 month probation review hearing to be conducted
AODA and comply with any recommendations

timeConds.notes: Defendant to serve 60 days conditional jail time as alternative to revocation to begin the date the amendment to JOC is signed by Judge White. Huber granted for work and to attend AODA counseling.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Richard Monthey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant discharged from probation on 3-3-16; unpaid supervision fees of $200; 3-21-16 hard copy rec'd
Agent Corey Endreas requests amendment to JOC due to probation violations
Defendant to serve 60 days conditional jail time as alternative to revocation to begin the date the amendment to JOC is signed by Judge White. Huber granted for work and to attend AODA counseling.
Waiver of Right to Attorney and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant.

Defendant, Robert Richard Monthey, appeared. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over for further proceedings, Information filed, waives reading, Waiver of Right to Atty filed, Court accepts Waiver, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads guilty to Ct. 1 in 14 CF 25, Judgment to be entered, 14 CM 48 dismissed, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years, maintain absolute sobriety, $518.00 fine/costs, $250.00 DNA Surcharge and DNA Sample, AODA and comply, 6 month probation review, bond to be applied, 3 days sentence credit, defendant to report to probation and parole by Noon tomorrow 3/4/14

Defendant Robert Richard Monthey by video with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Troy Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $250.00 cash bond, not to possess or consume any alcoholic beverages, standard felony conditions, waives time limits.
Not possess/consume alcohol beverages. standard felony conditions.
